Identification.ShortTitle: Maximum Amounts for Informal Procedure Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Increasing the Maximum Amounts that Apply in Respect of Appeals under the Informal Procedure

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice, pursuant to section 18.27* of the Tax Court of Canada Act, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations increasing the maximum amounts that apply in respect of appeals under the informal procedure.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Maximum Amounts for Informal Procedure Regulations.
In these Regulations, Act means the Tax Court of Canada Act. (Loi)
The amount of $7,000 referred to in paragraph 18(1)(a), section 18.1, subsections 18.11(2) and (3) and sections 18.12 and 18.13 of the Act is increased to $12,000.
The amount of $14,000 referred to in paragraph 18(1)(b) and sections 18.1, 18.12 and 18.13 of the Act is increased to $24,000.
Sections 3 and 4 apply in respect of appeals instituted on or after September 1, 1993.
